questions.question_text: Which option is a driver that influences stakeholder needs?

discussion.content:
Agree. From ISACA materials:
Stakeholder needs are influenced by a number of drivers, e.g., strategy changes, a changing business and regulatory
environment, and new technologies.

questions.question_text: What type of process goal is only known to and used by those who need it?

discussion.content:
Agree. From ISACA materials:
Accessibility and security goals—The process remains confidential, when required, and is known and accessible to
those who need it

choices.C: A focus on quick wins and prioritizing the most beneficial improvements that are #aֲ»ֲ»e*l lo implement is needed
choices.B: Significant incidents related to IT risk, such as data loss or project failure, have been experienced
choices.A: Tailoring COBIT and other supporting good practices and standards to Tit the unique context of the enterprise is required
choices.D: Key program roles and responsibilities should be defined and assigned

questions.question_text: Which factor may indicate a need for the improved governance of enterprise IT?

discussion.content: Framework Introduction and Methodology: I&T-Related Issues Design Factor

choices.D: Maturity and capability assessments are only defined by CMMI (Capability Maturity Model -Integrated), NOT by ISO15504
choices.A: Organizational maturity has a relationship to the achievement of the organization's business goals
choices.C: A maturity assessment can use the findings of a capability assessment
choices.B: A maturity assessment is done at an enterprise or organizational level and a capability assessment is done at a process level

questions.question_text: Which statement, related to capability and maturity, is NOT correct?
Which item is considered a good practice for inclusion within a policy framework?

discussion.content:
Agree. From ISACA materials:
– As part of the policy framework, the following items need to be described:
• Scope and validity
• The consequences of failing to comply with the policy
• The means for handling exceptions
• The manner in which compliance with the policy will be checked and measured
